item.title: Xbox Game Pass Core Library Is Adding 3 More Games Soon
item.description:
Xbox Game Pass Core will be adding three more titles for subscribers on October 1: Cities: Skylines – Remastered, Disney Dreamlight Valley , and Warhammer 40,000: Darktide . Microsoft introduced Xbox Game Pass Core, its lowest priced tier, in 2023 after discontinuing the long-lived Xbox Live Gold. It was a bittersweet time for gamers, but the decision also expanded the options available to subscribers.

Game Pass Core offers subscribers a curated library of at least 25 games, which are not swapped out as frequently as the titles in the service's other tiers. The selection includes a wide range of genres that have all been well received by gamers, ensuring that everybody has something to play, no matter their tastes. Currently, Fallout 4 and 76 , Doom Eternal, Dishonored 2, Tunic, Stardew Valley , and Elder Scrolls Online are among the titles available to play through Game Pass Core.

3 More Titles Are Coming to Xbox Game Pass Core

On October 1, Xbox Game Pass Core subscribers will be able to add Cities: Skylines – Remastered, Disney Dreamlight Valley , and Warhammer 40,000: Darktide to the titles at their disposal. These three games are already part of the Xbox Game Pass Standard subscription tier and can be enjoyed via cloud gaming as well. If purchased without a Game Pass membership, each of these releases currently retails for $39.99, so having them accessible via the Core subscription, which costs $9.99 a month, will likely be an interesting value proposition for many people.

  • Cities: Skylines – Remastered
  • Disney Dreamlight Valley
  • Warhammer 40,000: Darktide

Developed by Colossal Order and published by Paradox Interactive, the original version of Cities: Skylines was released in 2015 to critical success. As of 2022, it had sold 12 million copies across platforms. So it came as little surprise, then, when the remastered edition was released for consoles in 2023, offering performance enhancements and quality-of-life upgrades. There are also currently numerous DLC available for separate purchase, incluing everything from full expansions, cosmetics, and new assets. Cities: Skylines – Remastered has a 4-star review rating on Xbox.

Gameloft’s Disney Dreamlight Valley was released in 2023 on multiple platforms and was an instant success, winning a variety of awards like Best Game Design and Indie Game of the Year. The eponymous valley features various locations inhabited by popular characters from Disney and Pixar IPs. There are many DLC available to purchase for Disney Dreamlight Valley , like “The Storybook Vale,” which adds a new biome, house style, animal companion, and outfits. Disney Dreamlight Valley also has a 4-star rating on Xbox.

Warhammer 40,000: Darktide currently is sitting at a 3.5-star rating on Xbox and a “Mostly Positive” rating on Steam. First released in 2022 for PC, the Xbox version came out in 2023. A first-person action game developed and published by Fatshark, Darktide is considered the spiritual successor to the popular Vermintide series and is a strong addition to the Xbox Game Pass Core library.

item.title: PS Plus Extra and Premium Games for September 2025 Are Available Now
item.description:
The Extra and Premium tiers of PlayStation Plus have been updated and now include eight fresh games for subscribers to check out. The Extra and Premium tiers of PlayStation Plus are updated on a monthly basis, and so subscribers regularly have something new to play.

Those signed up for the Extra and Premium tiers of PlayStation Plus aren't restricted to just playing the games added to those tiers. They are also free to snag the free games added to the Essential tier of PlayStation Plus as well. The free PS Plus games for September 2025 are available for subscribers to claim right now as well, and include some big-name releases. For those that may have missed the announcement, the free PS Plus games for September 2025 consist of 3D platformer Psychonauts 2 , farm/life sim Stardew Valley , and puzzle game Viewfinder .

PS Plus Extra and Premium subscribers have been able to claim the free games for a couple of weeks, and now they can check out the new titles added specifically to those tiers. The new PS Plus Extra games for September 2025 are Conscript , Crow Country , Fate/Samurai Remnant , Green Hell , Persona 5 Tactica , The Invincible , and WWE 2K25 . Those signed up for PS Plus Premium can play all of those games as well as Legacy of Kain: Defiance .

PS Plus Extra and Premium Games for September 2025 List

  • Conscript
  • Crow Country
  • Fate/Samurai Remnant
  • Green Hell
  • Legacy of Kain: Defiance (Premium only)
  • Persona 5 Tactica
  • The Invincible
  • WWE 2K25

While this isn't the biggest update to the PS Plus Extra and Premium libraries this year, it's a fairly solid one. Conscript and Crow Country are great for horror game fans, while those wanting to experience the complete Legacy of Kain experience can now do so on PS4 and PS5 thanks to the debut of Legacy of Kain: Defiance . Persona 5 Tactica should appeal to fans of strategy games, especially if they are big into Persona 5 , and WWE 2K25 is a well-reviewed wrestling game that's not even a year old yet, adding significant value to the service.

Unfortunately, the latest update to PS Plus Extra and Premium also meant that some games were given the boot. PS Plus removed seven games with the latest update, with Dragon's Crown Pro , FIST: Forged in Shadow Torch , Odin Sphere Leifthrasir , Pistol Whip , Road 96 , The Plucky Squire , and UFC 5 all shown the door.

item.title: Digimon Story: Time Stranger Leak Reveals Massive List of Digimon
item.description:
The full roster of over 450 Digimon featured in Digimon Story: Time Stranger has leaked on social media due to a datamine of the game's demo. Digimon Story: Time Stranger will have over 100 more digital critters to meet compared to its predecessor, Digimon Story: Cyber Sleuth , though keen-eyed fans spotted a few roster cuts in the upcoming game as well.

Digimon Story: Time Stranger is a turn-based RPG that allows players to customize their party of Digimon to overcome various challenges. Along with battle-focused features such as Digivolution, Agent Skills, and the Digimon Personality System, previews of Digimon Story: Time Stranger have showcased some of the game's quality-of-life features that can quicken its battle pace. Of course, Digimon Story: Time Stranger will feature many fan-favorite Digimon, including Agumon, Veemon, Gomamon, and other creatures that players can discover and add to their parties throughout the story.

The Full Digimon Story: Time Stranger Roster Has Leaked

Although the launch of Digimon Story: Time Stranger is just a few weeks away as of this writing, some fans have already discovered which Digimon will be featured in the upcoming adventure. On the Gaming Leaks and Rumors subreddit, a Google spreadsheet was posted that listed 452 Digimon by stage order, starting with the first stage (Baby) and continuing to the Mega and Ultra levels. The leaked list was composed of data taken from the Digimon Story: Time Stranger demo, and each entry was identified by its Japanese name. For example, Salamon and Gatomon are respectively known as Plotmon and Tailmon on the leaked roster. Along with partner Digimon like Agumon and Gabumon, new entries, including Aegiosmon and its later forms, were seen on the leaked list. Entries from the Digimon Frontier anime, including Ranamon and Calmaramon, were also included.

The list shared the Digivolution paths that each Digimon could take, though the stat and personality requirements were not posted. Some fans noted that Digimon Story: Cyber Sleuth featured 341 Digimon, meaning the base version of Time Stranger has a bigger roster by a margin of 111 entries. However, not every Digimon featured in Cyber Sleuth made it to Time Stranger . The Sistermon and Arkadimon lines, along with Mega Digimon with the NX suffix, were not listed in the leaked list. Additionally, some pre-order bonuses for Digimon Story: Time Stranger , such as Agumon Black and Gabumon Black, were not counted.

With over 450 possible monsters to tame and befriend, Digimon Story: Time Stranger has quite the bestiary for players to fill out. With a Season Pass already confirmed, it remains to be seen how many more Digimon will be added to Time Stranger in later updates.

Digimon Story: Time Stranger

item.title: Baby Steps Devs Share Hilarious Behind the Scenes Stories
item.description:
Part of what makes Baby Steps stand out as a literal walking simulator is how it treats failure and challenge as comedy. Every trip or awkward stumble into a rock feels like it was designed to get a laugh out of the player, even though there is a very real goal for them to achieve in the game. However, that humor isn't just reserved for the players, and it's not even limited to Baby Steps ' gameplay. Rather, it's something that played a major role in the game's development behind the scenes as well.

In an interview with Game Rant, Baby Steps developers Bennett Foddy and Gabe Cuzzillo shared some of their favorite stories from the game's development, from watching their friends obsess over pointless climbs to discovering new ways to play during internal tests. These hilarious recounts go to show just how much Baby Steps manages to create comedy both in front of the screen and behind it, often in ways that even the developers didn't expect.

Behind the Scenes, Baby Steps Is Just as Funny as Onscreen

One of Cuzzillo's first stories highlights just how stubborn and entertaining Baby Steps ' challenges can be, as his cousin attempted to achieve a climbing feat the developers never designed to be achieved. The funniest part of this story is actually the fact that the developers allowed Cuzzillo's cousin so much time to attempt this climb and never told him that it was a fruitless endeavor, as the developer explained:

"One of my favorite reactions was from my cousin, who played about half the game before he came upon a rock formation he decided to try to climb. It wasn't something we designed, and it didn't lead anywhere in particular, but he became hell-bent on trying to get up it. It took him 8 hours of attempts in the end before he did it. Finding skate spots like that in the world is one of my favorite things to do in the game, and I hope more people find themselves drawn to this kind of play."

Cuzzillo never got into what his cousin's reaction was after spending 8 hours climbing a rock that led to nothing in Baby Steps , but one can imagine he might have been frustrated and annoyed, or he might have found it infuriatingly hilarious. Either way, at least the developers got a kick out of it, and they'll likely get a kick out of players doing the same thing once the game launches.

That playful spirit isn't just limited to the players, however, as the developers came up with their own ways to turn Baby Steps into something new, using it as both a testing tool and a kind of personal competition. Foddy elaborated on this when asked if the team had any fun internal stories they could share about what it was like playing the game behind the scenes:

"One of the various ways we go about finding bugs or flaws in the level design is to design race courses within the game world and try to finish fastest, with two computers side-by-side. I really recommend it as a way for friends to play together once they’ve beaten the game: write down a list of tasks or waypoints that might have multiple possible routes, and see who can do it faster. You'd be surprised how often a seemingly insurmountable lead is whittled away as the leader fails a simple climb over and over. I think you could even set up a version of the infamous Barkley Marathons in the game."

And these stories are most likely just the tip of the iceberg. Once players, streamers, and content creators get their hands on Baby Steps , there are bound to be many more hilarious tales where these came from. It's really just a reminder that Baby Steps ' funniest moments are ultimately born out of the absurd situations it naturally puts players in.

Baby Steps

item.title: Party Animals Codes (September 2025)
item.description:
Quick Links

  • All Party Animals Codes
  • How to Redeem Codes in Party Animals
  • How to Get More Party Animals Codes

Party Animals is a video game that is perfect for having fun with friends. Its gameplay and physics are reminiscent of Gang Beasts, where all the characters are clumsy and move very funny. Party Animals has many modes that you can play with random players with a voice chat or invite your friends to the lobby even if they haven't bought the game.

Also, the game has a large selection of cool skins of cute animals that you can buy for in-game currency or get in the battle pass. Fortunately, you can also get free skins if you redeem Party Animals codes.

Updated September 16, 2025, by Artur Novichenko: There are several rewards available in Party Animals right now, giving you the chance to unlock different skins for your characters. From cats to dogs and even a fox, each option adds a bit of variety to your collection. These freebies don’t affect gameplay but let you customize your look in unique ways. More rewards could be introduced in future updates, so it’s worth coming back to see what gets added next.

All Party Animals Codes

Working Party Animals Codes

  • VICKSY - Enter this code to get Vicksy fox skin. (NEW)
  • LIRIK - Enter this code to get Nayna, Nomu, and Lirik cat skins.
  • beardbox - Enter this code to get Kiko cat skin.
  • joshandkato - Enter this code to get Kato dog skin.
  • S7 - Enter this code to get Smil7y dog skin.

Expired Party Animals Codes

  • HAPPYHAPPYNEMO2024
  • LUCKINCOFFEE

How to Redeem Codes in Party Animals

In Roblox and mobile games, it is often possible to redeem codes, so players usually know how to do it. However, this feature is rare in PC and console games, so gamers may not know how to get rewards. In Party Animals , redeeming codes can be done in just a few clicks, but you may still need help navigating the interface. Therefore, we have created a guide explaining how to redeem codes in Party Animals .

  • Launch Party Animals .
  • Pay attention to the lower-left corner of the screen. Click the button with the dog in the stall to go to the Item Shop.
  • Find the Redeem button at the top.
  • In the white box, paste the code from the list of working codes and click Redeem.

If you play Party Animals through Friend Pass, many features are blocked for you, including code redemption. Therefore, if you want to get rewards, you will have to buy the full version of the game to get rewards.

How to Get More Party Animals Codes

Codes for games can bring you a lot of cool rewards, but they are hard to find. While there are many sources of information for Roblox and mobile games, for games like Party Animals , finding working codes is a real challenge. Therefore, to help you, we create and update guides with codes so that you can always get rewards. Bookmark this site in your browser with Ctrl + D so you don't lose it. Alternatively, you can visit the Party Animals developers' social media for more information.

  • Party Animals X page
  • Party Animals YouTube channel
Party Animals
